fields.description:
When a user visits Plan Mode for the first time (i.e. their client side cache is cleared) they should be shown the "instructions" detail view.

Currently on default branch, this is not the case.

I think this has something to do with the url parameters being populated with these settings when switching to Plan Mode:

{code}
RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=7
    &view=planning.nodetail   // this should not be set?
{code}
fields.summary: Default detail view behaviour on Plan Mode is incorrect
Epic Label Colours

fields.description: The list of boards in the Manage Boards page is growing pretty quick. We would like to be able to search for a board by its name and/or owner. Similar to the existing Jira functionality to search for Filters and Dashboards.
fields.summary: Add Quick Search feature on "Manage Boards" screen

fields.description:
As an administrator I'd like to configure the count of menu items displaying the recent boards in the Agile menu.

Reason: We are all using 5-10 boards all the time, however, just some of them are displayed in the Agile menu as menu items in section "Recent Boards". In GH 6.0.0 it was easier to navigate to other boards with the combo box that popped up when I clicked on the board name. This disappeared in GH 6.0.3.
fields.summary: As an administrator I'd like to configure the count of menu items displaying the recent boards in the Agile menu
Make the Epic Label "Required" in all relevant Field Configurations when the Epic Label field is created (when labs feature is enabled)
Arrow in colour box disappears when I move mouse away although menu is still open

fields.description: After clicking the arrow and viewing the menu, drag an issue or an epic into a different order without closing the menu. The menu stays where it is, it should close.
fields.summary: Dropdown menu doesn't disappear when dragging issues or epics

fields.description:
Instead of "Toggle Epic Panel"

let's toggle between

Show Epic Panel
Hide Epic Panel
fields.summary: Change Epic toggle menu label

fields.description:
1. Select issue 1, edit estimate
2. drag different issue and drop at new location.
-> issue does not exist error shows up

The problem seems to be a backlog reload, so the dragged issue ends up being invisible (the dom element might have gone away). so when dropping it can't find the id and boom...
fields.summary: Ranking in plan mode while inline edit is active results in errors
Escaping when having story over epic still adds the story to the epic
Epic creation message incorrectly mentions epic not being visible why it is visible

fields.description:
This should offer similar functionality to the planning mode for the Scrum Boards as in [Using Plan Mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+Plan+Mode]. For example:

* Display and estimate.
* Organising via Epics.
* Column Done status.
* Swim lane and cell constraints.
fields.summary: As a Kanban PO I would like the Plan mode so that I may order and groom a large backlog

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to specify a value which restricts the number of issues displayed in a column to that value and provides "pages" to cycle through excess issues.

This is similar to the "column constraints" setting, but without the side effect of changing colors -- the goal is to reduce the number of issues actually displayed and improve performance on lower-resource systems (like iPads) when > 30 issues are in a column.
fields.summary: Paging of Board Columns based on Length
Add clarrification that red dot for the time in status

fields.description:
It should fill the height of the viewport.

On epic branch.
fields.summary: Details view height maxes at column height
Investigate replacement date/time picker
Create Epic button should not show for read only user
Limit length of Epic name field
Removing quick filter also removes Epic filter

fields.description: See the attached screenshot
fields.summary: With sprint report enhancements could we highlight the 'sub row' in the first and last lists of heaps of issues?
Can we allow typing entry of times and dates in the bottom of the calendar picker for Sprint start/ends

fields.description: During discussions with a customer we discussed the option of asking for a comment when an issue is flagged so that you can understand what happened.
fields.summary: As a user, when flagging an issue I'd like to be asked for a comment

fields.description:
When trying to change the name of the epic label field, I get an error then GH is disabled. 

This shouldn't happen ... looks like an error with the searcher.
fields.summary: Renaming epic label field causes GreenHopper to blow up and disable itself

fields.description:
As a Rapid Board configurer, 
I want to know that accidental Rapid Board deletions can be undone by administrators
So that I don't have to spend hours recreating my 12 project board with 20+ quick filters.

I'm floored that the only option is to restore the database to a previous backup.
Isn't the only time this table is searched (as opposed to {{WHERE ID=9}}) when we're in Manage Rapid Boards? That screen doesn't need to be super fast (not that adding a soft-delete flag would be slow anyhow).

In other words please make
{code}
UPDATE ..._RAPIDVIEW SET deleted=0 WHERE ID=9
{code}

an option (or some such thing)
fields.summary: Implement Rapid Board deletion as a soft delete
Dates span two lines when detail view open on minimum resolution

fields.description: See screenshot.
fields.summary: 255 character summary not truncated to shorter, expands the size of the epic bar

fields.description:
Currently the rapid board implementation does not support all features the classic board does. Thus we decided not to use it at the moment.

Therefore we need a switch to either select the Classic or Rapid Board which can be set by the admin only.
fields.summary: Implement an Agile Board switch

fields.description:
See screenshot.

Feature flag off, it shouldn't have this whitespace here.
fields.summary: Blank space where epic bar should be

fields.description: Ability to rank quickly to certain regions: top of backlog, certain upcoming sprint, certain current sprint
fields.summary: Rank Targets

fields.description:
* DONE https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Editing+or+Renaming+a+Sprint
* DONE https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Editing+or+Renaming+an+Epic
* DONE https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ending+a+Sprint
* DONE https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Creating+a+Sprint and https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Deleting+a+Sprint (see GHS-6196)
* LEAVE THIS ONE: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-EpicLink
fields.summary: for 6.1: remove 6.0.x version-specific instructions

fields.description:
FINAL BEHAVIOR:

1. For fields with options (epic status):
If everything is 1:1 like the original configuration, then lock the field, otherwise don't lock the field

1a. Unless there is all projects/appropriate issues field scheme with ZERO options in there. In that case we will just add the options.

1b. Unless there are no schemes, in which case we introduce our own.

2. For fields without option fix up the contexts then lock the field

3. do NOT fix up field names/descriptions for any of the fields

3a. But fix the searcher.

4. for the Rank field, change managed level to "admin" (field creation) plus a message that the field should normally not be created as GH creates the field

5. The default rank field should be fixed up in context and then locked.



In JIRA 5.2 there is a new API around Managed Configuration Items. This allows a plugin to specify that instances of custom fields, and custom field types, are "managed" by the plugin and should not be modified/created by administrators.

Fields to be restricted (no edit, no create):
All Issue Types/Global Context:
- Epic Link(show)
- Sprint(show)
- Rank(show)

Epics only/Global Context
- Epic Status(show)
- Epic Name(show/require/renderer - default text)
- Epic Color(show)

We must also ensure that existing fields are in the correct configuration before locking them down.

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Is fixVersions one of these since we rely on it for release planning?
A: (/) No - it is a system field provided by JIRA and therefore should be locked by definition.

Q: Rank field?
A: (/) Also fix/lock the default rank field
fields.summary: As a GH developer, I would like for the custom fields that GH creates to appear as "managed" in JIRA's administration interface

fields.description:
In https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Ending+a+Sprint the completing a sprint screenshot has info on how to complete it for 6.0.2 using the cog icon, however for 6.0.1 it uses a different icon (the upper right arrow, as in https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=300810309).

A customer contacted us as they were looking for the cog rather than the up arrow, is there any chance it could be broken down into 6.0.1 and 6.0.2 screenshots?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Please update the Ending a Sprint documentation to be more clearer

fields.description:
The View Issue Screen that appears on the right hand side of a Rapid Board when you select an issue comes with a set of tabs and fields on display - see attached.

I would like to be able to configure which fields are displayed under the first tab, that is, the Details tab.
fields.summary: Make GreenHopper View Issue Screen configurable
update pic for Work mode showing issue count in column header
greenhopper board report date format does not follow jira date format

fields.summary: Exception when creating the first epic

fields.description:
Until GHS-5120 and GHS-5386 can be fixed, subtasks can easily become orphaned if you have a workflow like I describe in GHS-5120 (which is very close to Atlassian's JIRA workflow).

Because of these bugs, I have made my Agile Board filters exclude subtasks with {{issuetype in standardIssueTypes()}}. I didn't expect that on the Detail View's Subtasks tab they would be hidden saying "2 sub-tasks are being filtered by the board's Saved Filter". It doesn't make any sense to me to hide subtasks when trying to get more detail on an issue. A subtask is detail about the issue just like description, comments, etc. 

To me, I feel all subtasks should always be shown in that tab, regardless of if they are visible in a column on the Agile Board.
fields.summary: As a manager, I want to filter out subtasks from my Agile Board columns but still allow the detail view's subtasks tab to show them

fields.description:
{{As an agile board user, I would like to export the reports into a common format to show my product owner, who doesn't have access to my JIRA, so that he/she can see the sprint progress.}}

 

It would be extremely useful to be able to export the many great JIRA Software reports into at least one common format (e.g. PDF, excel, etc.). Our project's product owner is not local to us at all and cannot access out JIRA instance on our closed network. The only means we have of doing this currently is via a browser "Print or "Print Screen". Both of these solutions require major browser window formatting in order to work and have it appear barely readable.
fields.summary: Ability to export the Sprint reports into a common format

fields.description: I would like to be able to edit/delete a comment in the Issue Details panel. Only users with Comment editing/Delete permission should have this options available.
fields.summary: Allow to edit/delete "Comments" in the Issue details panel

fields.description:
We operate in sprints where we are often picking up 10+ stories, and our scrum process includes breaking those into subtasks, which often results in 20+ stories on the board.  We use a digital wall board to display our task board using the Wallboard gadget.  This gadget does not make good use of screen space, using up the entire width of a column for a story.

Using the classic wallboard, it was still slightly painful as we had to zoom/unzoom the wallboard to make things fit dynamically.  When you unzoomed, columns would fit multiple tasks into one column making it more efficient.  Now, a wallboard needs to be zoomed out to the point where you cannot read it in order to properly visualize every task.


Possible resolutions might be:

- Support side-by-side task visualization within each column
- Dynamically size the wallboard to fit all active tasks
- Dynamically size the columns so they don't use 1/3 or 1/4 of the screen when they're empty
- Visualize subtasks as smaller items so they don't take as much real estate

With swimlanes enabled for stories, things are even worse.
fields.summary: GreenHopper wallboard does not visualize many items on one screen nicely
As a user, I would like to be able to use JQL to retrieve all the issues in a specific sprint (open, current and closed)

fields.description:
Currently, only the first sprint that can be started. So, the ability to move sprints up and down in plan mode would be really useful without having to move planned issues around just to make a sprint to be at the top.

Also, there's a weird way to move a sprint to the top. 
* At least an issue need to be inside the sprint e.g. sprint A. 
* Then, drag the footer of sprint(A) to be at other sprint/s' footer at the top.
* This will kicked out all the issues in sprint(A) into backlog or any sprint below it.
* Sprint(A) will be place at the dragged position.

This is not a suitable workaround as it will caused more confusion than it will helps.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to re-organize pre-sprints in planning mode

fields.description:
This is because the version of the RESTful table component that we are using did not have an {{allowDelete}} flag, and {{allowEdit}} does not transfer to {{allowDelete}}.

Speaking with [~sharwood], we will need to pull in a newer version of the component, which has the fix.
fields.summary: Delete operation is available in all RESTful tables for users who cannot edit configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6129].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Supported+Platforms

The requirements for the latest stable release of jira (on premises) state that it works with JRE 1.6 and 1.7
According to the installation notes on your website, greenhopper 6.0.4 is supposed to work with the latest version of JIRA.
I tried to install greenhopper on top of the latest stable release of jira (on premises) with Sun JRE 1.7 update 7, but couldnt activate.
The error message was quite unhelpful, telling me there was a problem contacting the jira server, there was a problem with the license etc.
There was an indication to check the log files, but nowhere is the location of these files disclosed. 
I had to snoop around for quite some time and eventually found a line in a log file indicating a module used by greenhopper needed to be a particalur version which research lead me to find this meant JRE 1.6 was required.
After installing JRE 1.6 greenhopper works.
For the sake of keeping your customers happy, I strongly advise that you
* correct the documentation for greenhopper installation to include the proper requirements for a successful installation (a greenhopper problem)
* provide some indication of log file location from the user interface (a jira problem)
* provide better module error messages (a jira problem)
fields.summary: Support Platforms/Installation Requirements don't Mention GH is Incompatible with JRE 1.7

fields.description:
- Default on new boards is not to show sat / sunday in the timezone of the server
- Affects burndown chart only (and mini burndown in sprint report)
- Default to timezone of server but allow to be changed
- Display timezone being used
- New reports tab in configuration
- Allow additional days to be specified
- If JIRA has a weekend setting use that for the default (rather than just Sat/Sun)

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Must test when there is a switch-over from standard time to daylight savings.
A: (x) Not Tested

Q: What if the non-working days are not valid?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if all days are marked as non-working days?
A: (x) Not Tested

Q: What if the sprint starts or ends on a non-working day?
A: (x) Not Tested

Q: Is there support for defining which days are your weekend? aka the Saudi case
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Is the chart displayed in the client's timezone, the user's timezone (from profile), or server? Chart should line up with the sprint dates.
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if there are datapoints in a non-working day time period (shaded area)? Are they treated the same or excluded?
A: (x) Not Tested

Q: What if 2 non-working periods overlap?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Do any of these questions surprise you? If so, what hadn't you previously considered?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: Have checkboxes in board configuration for Burndown to specify days that are not working days, shade that area of the graph and have the guideline be level at that point

fields.description:
Create a sprint and populate it
open the same plan mode in a second browser window
delete the sprint in the first
drag an issue into the deleted sprint in the second window

see screenshot
fields.summary: Improve messaging when interacting with stale sprint which has been removed on Plan Mode

fields.description:
Currently, one has to create a JIRA version manually, then go to the completed sprint report, from there click "see all completed issues in navigator", and then do a bulk change to set the fix version. 

It would be much more convenient if there was  a "create a JIRA release for this sprint" button somewhere on the sprint report tab, which automatically links completed sprint issues with the newly created release.
fields.summary: As a sprint manager, I'd like a convenient way to link a completed sprint with a JIRA software release

fields.description:
When a Rapid Board filter excludes a status (e.g. Resolved) then transitioning all issues to that status will make the Sprint Disappear with _There are no active sprints._

This seems to make sense as we seem to bring GH to a point where an empty sprint has been started (which is not permitted from the Plan Mode) but shouldn't we prevent that from happening or provide some kind of warning?

I have created [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Sprint+Disappears] for now where a test case is described.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like a message when an issue is transitioned out of Rapid Board context so that I know why my Sprint disappears

fields.description: As investigation uncovered, this is more an AUI problem.
fields.summary: Add row style is "disabled" but does not visually look different when another row is being edited

fields.description: On JAC there is no grabber, but on the new table there is one. See attachment on parent issue.
fields.summary: Grabber is appearing on Everything Else row when it should not
Buttons are visible after moving row in Card Colours
JQL validation badge is not correct
Everything Else row should not have a JQL edit control

fields.description:
Steps:

# Start with Queries strategy
# Note the rows that are already present
# Add some rows
# Change swimlane strategy to something else
# Change swimlane strategy back to Queries

The added rows are not shown.

This is not the same as the old behaviour.
fields.summary: New swimlane rows do not display after changing swimlane strategy

fields.description: It is too restrictive to only allow editing of a Rapid Board by a single user.  A Rapid Board should be editable by a group of users.
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper user with a large team I would like multiple scrum leads to be able to edit one Rapid Board

fields.description:
In GreenHopper, we are allowed to create a Scrum board for a specific project. And from there, we may plan a Sprint and include some of the issues into the list. Hence, while some of the issues are inside the Sprint, some may be left out as a Backlog. However at the moment, there's no Condition to restrict the execution of a workflow transition if an issue is not part of an active Sprint.

It will be great if we can add a workflow condition to check if an issue is part of a Sprint, and restrict the execution of a workflow transition if the issue is not part of a Sprint.
fields.summary: Add a workflow condition to validate if an issue is part of an active Sprint

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)
(x) Be sure to check the visibility for this with admin, non-admin, and anonymous permissions
- Non-admin and anon should be the same

(x) Be sure to check multiple on-off
fields.summary: Add 'Enable Epic Labs' box on to Getting Started screen (like it was for Scrum support)
Improve the wording describing the "Unmapped Statuses" section of the "Columns" tab so that users understand that statuses which appear in here will not be displayed on the board

fields.description:
Situation: I've got a rap.... err, board which filters based on a component. When I'm creating todo-style subtasks, I need to remember to fill in the component of the parent task, otherwise they drop out of the filter.

It would be cool if metadata fields like fixversion, component, label would be automatically prefilled when creating subtasks.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like parent issue data to be prefilled when creating a subtask

fields.description:
COS:
- Show in both plan and work mode
- Don't show it on sub tasks

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: Make sure detail view updated after label update/removal
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Will tasks or improvements get labels too?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Make sure color is updated correctly too
A: (x) Don't need to worry about colour for now, this is a text only representation.
fields.summary: Show Epic label in detail view for story

fields.description:
COS:
- Fixed palette to start with
- Requires edit issue permission
- Use the colour custom field we have created

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: How does an open colour picker interact with the following:
Clicking other inline edits (x)
Closing the epics or detail panel (x)
Switching modes (x)
Drag and Drop (x)
Create/Delete sprints (x)
Reordering epics (x)
Multi-select (x)
Opening the tools menu (x)
Applying quick/instant filters(x)
Creating a new issue (x)
Create a new epic (x)
Anything I'm missing (?)

Q: What if the exact same colour is chosen as another epic?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Are default colours still rotated?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q:
fields.summary: Allow editing of the colour swatch for an Epic

fields.description: This may be an additional story, but I had shown some designs around giving users an additional way of knowing the backlog was filtered by Epic - originally I had put the epic label on the headers of backlog containers (sprints and backlog) but that might be problematic.  Martin had suggested re-using the active quickfilters area, which has merit.  Will add design task to explore.
fields.summary: Multiple select for Epic filtering

fields.description:
COS: 
- Include in the URL
- In addition to the selected status of an issue

Discussion:
Selection states across tiered items: parent/child - 
Mimic some common approaches like mail clients - folder can be selected, when child item is selected, folder has a "secondary selection" that shows it is still active,  but not the active selection.

Bringing up details - 
Thinking about this further in light of showing the Epic "details" on the right, I don't think we want to do this on Select of the Epic.  That should be a primary action that is to filter the backlog list.

It may be worthwhile to add a "details" affordance though to manually display the issue details for an epic (just not on epic selection).   I'll add that to the next iteration of the design.
fields.summary: Make selected status of Epic remembered

fields.description:
COS: 
- Not included in URL
- Does store expanded state of multiple Epics
fields.summary: Make expanded status of Epic sticky

fields.description:
COS:
- Green is the sum of the estimate value for the completed stories, the line (unfilled section) is the sum of the estimate value for the incompleted stories
- Tooltip shows both estimate sums and %'s
- Put in expanded Epic information panel 

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: How will this handle filtered issues?
A: (x) Doesn't change 

Q: What happens to the bar if there is no estimation statistic for the board?
A: (x) There always is

Q: What if a non-story points estimate is chosen?
A: (x) The bar should represent the completed % of whatever estimate statistic is used. 

Q: What if there are no stories to estimate, or there's only 1?
A: (x) If there are no stories it shows as completed (nothing left outstanding right?) If there are no stories estimated it shows as completed unless the estimation statistic is issue count. If there's one story with an estimate incompleted it shows as empty. 

Q: What about the estimates on subtasks? Are those summed as well?
A: (x) No. These are used only for remaining estimate. 

Q: Does the bar update if an invalid estimate is entered?
A: (x) No

Q: Does the bar update on estimate change of a story in the sprint?
A: (x) You can't change an estimate of a story in a sprint once it's started. If it hasn't started then yes.

Q: Does the bar update on drag of a story into the sprint? 
A: (x) No, only on stories being completed or added into an epic.
fields.summary: Implement the estimate done vs estimate undone progress bar

fields.description:
COS:
- Coloured section of bar is the number of issues that have an estimate applied, uncoloured (line) section of the bar is the count of issues with no estimate applied 
- Tooltip shows both issue counts and %'s
- Put in expanded Epic information panel unestimated and estimated

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: How will this handle filtered issues?
A: Ignores filtering

Q: What if there are no stories in the epic, or only 1?
A: The bar will not show for zero, will be small if % is small

Q: What if no estimate statistic is selected for the board?
A: One is always selected

Q: What if stories are removed from the sprint?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens when the last one gets removed?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: And another one added after that?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: Implement estimated vs unestimated stories progress bar

fields.description:
Minimum Criteria: 
- Cross on booger
- No warning on removal

-Goal is to work with design to actually design this before implementation-

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: Who can remove from an epic?
A: (/) Only the admin

Q: What if the epic itself is deleted? Are stories automatically unassigned from it?
A: (/) Yes

Q: What if the issue is not currently visible due to filter/column mapping?
A: (/) If an issue is not visible, you have no mechanism to unassigne it
fields.summary: Allow a story to be unassigned from any Epic

fields.description:
COS: 
- Implement drop down menu
- Include View in JIRA link in there
- Middle/Cmd click open in new tab works

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: Make sure open drop down handles 
(x) Epics panel closing
(x) dragging issues within backlog and to epics
(x) quick/instant filter
(x) switching modes
(x) open/closing of detail view
(x) inline edits
(x) any of the other dropdowns opening
fields.summary: Drop down on Epic with View in JIRA link

fields.description:
COS: 
- Epic should not be in the backlog list
- When starting a sprint Epics are NOT included

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: Check that Epics are not draggable into the backlog area.
A: if the epics feature is enabled, no epic is available in the backlog list and then you can not drag and drop it. If the feature is disabled then you can drag and drop the epics like any issue type (bug, story etc.)
fields.summary: Make sure that Epics do not get included in to the sprint (at the moment they are in the backlog and get put in to a sprint)

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: What does temporary mean and how will a user know that? If they get used to it, and it disappears, they will be >:/
A: (/) that's why it's Labs™

Q: Does this interact with the Epics sidebar twixie?
A: (x) The toggle menu state reflects the current state of the Epic Panel (see GHS-6179)

Q: If so, do they play nicely together?
A: (x) Yes

Q: Does hide/show mean the entire panel and twixie go away, or does it actually mean expand/collapse?
A: (x) Expand/Collapse

Q: Must test with all states of pan mode: Epics expanded/collapsed/populated/un-populated, backlog empty/filled, detail view open/closed
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens when jumping to Work and Report mode and back?
A: (x) Persists

Q: Is this persisted across logins/users?
A: (x) I think each user should own his/her own state

Q: Who has permission to do this? Can non-admin or anonymous users do this?
A: (x) Anyone
fields.summary: Temporary tools menu option to hide/show Epics (only on plan mode)

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Need to test all states: Matrix of Epics open/populated, issues in backlog exist/don't exist, and Detail view open/closed/help text
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Check above at minimum resolution
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Look for overlapping panels, and try with long but reasonable length data in relevantly displayed fields.
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: Plan mode layout for 3 panels (to bring in the closable detail view and allow closable Epic panel)

fields.description:
COS: 
- Add flag
- Wrap existing prototype code with a check for the flag
- Convert the creation of Epic related fields to be on the switch of this flag as opposed to the current update task approach

(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: What happens to Epics fields if Labs is disabled after enabling?
A: The fields remain in the system, as we don't delete fields

Q: What if those fields are deleted after Labs is disabled?
A: The field won't be recreated as it isn't used anymore

Q: And what if a user again re-enables Labs?
A: All missing fields are created/recreated upon first usage

Q:If Epic Labs is disabled, can I still interact with previously created Epics?
A: Yes, but they show up as normal issues inside the backlog
fields.summary: Create labs feature to enable Epic support

fields.description:
I often need to browse through issues that belong to a column, or even a "cell" (intersection of column and swim lane). I can do this with "j" and "k" on the RapidBoard.
Unfortunately, the Details view of the RapidBoard isn't very practical: you don't see all information at a glance (I need to see at least summary + priority + description + affects/fix version) because they are dispatched to tabs. Therefore, I need to open each issue using "o" and then return to the RapidBoard to move to the next issue.

It'd be much more practical to be able to navigate between issues directly in the View Issue screen.

Incidentally, this capability already exists for search results. A simple solution would therefore be to leverage this feature by opening issues from the RapidBoard _in a search context_ corresponding to the JQL query that "defines" the contents of the current "cell".

Or you could port the "Issue Navigator" button that existed in each column of the classic GH task boards to the RapidBoard.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to navigate in View Issue mode between issues of the same RapidBoard "cell"

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)
Q: What happens if this field is deleted/removed from the screen?
A: It won't appear on the screen.

Q: What if it is renamed?
A: In theory, it should just display with the new name but atm, GH blows up and disables itself. See subtask GHS-6162. 

Q: What if the field's permissions are modified?
A: It doesn't show up. 

Further testing notes:
- the field is added to the screen for the create issue operation for the epic issue type
- it's not added to screens within an issue type screen scheme that is not associated to any projects
- if there is a specific screen scheme for epics, it's only added to those screens - otherwise screens within the default scheme
fields.summary: Add Epic Label to the Create Issue Screen in JIRA config so it will show up in the Epic Quick Create dialog

fields.description:
When sub-task is created using the Create Sub-Task button on the View Issue screen and Greenhopper is enabled, the parent Fix Version is set on the Sub-Task, even though the Fix Version field was blank on the Sub-Task creation.

If Greenhopper is disabled, Fix Version is not set, as expected.

Tested using Greenhopper 6.0.3
fields.summary: Sub-task inherits parent fix-version when GreenHopper is enabled

fields.description:
There is currently no way of getting what sprint future stories are planned for.  This makes it hard to create reports with this information.

I have 6 sprints and only have one current sprint.  I would like to know what stories are planned for the other 5 sprints.
fields.summary: Allow getting of non-current sprint to be retreieved by REST

fields.description: Add hours completed, hours left under each column (optional?).  Add a progress bar of how complete listed tasks are.  After these are added, there is no need to use classic anymore.
fields.summary: Add details for work scrum

fields.description:
It is an expected behavior whereby the *Subtasks* should follow the *Parent Issue* when the ranking is changed for *GreenHopper* and that is how the *Ranking* concept is implemented. Eventhough that it may not be the case all the time but that is the architecture of *GreenHopper* by default. However, it would be handy to have the flexibility of drag-and-drop issues, regardless of the level.

Example: If you change the ranking of a parent issue the subtasks will be moved also. This may not always be the case.
fields.summary: Issue Ranking for all User Issues regardless the level (Parent Issue, Sub-tasks)

fields.description:
(coming from a dedicated customer: )

In Rapid Board configuration, there is the possibility to add Quick Filters that will show up as buttons in Plan and Work Mode:
!quick filters.png!

Would it be possible to go through my existing filters rather than having to copy and paste the JQL query?
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user I would like to be able to configure Quick Filters by shuffling through existing filters in JIRA

fields.description:
Hello team,

We understand that GreenHopper considers the rightmost column as "DONE", the leftmost column as "To Do" and any columns, no matter how many, in between those as "In Progress" and we would like to have the ability to choose which columns should be mapped to "To Do" or "Done".

Please find an attached screenshot for further reference.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Ability to configure more than one column on "To Do" or "Done" Board status

fields.description: An improvement when a task is first moved into *In Progress*, it updates the *Parent Stories* status to also be *In progress*. Much in the way it does when we close all *Subtasks* and it prompts us to close the *Parent Story*.
fields.summary: When sub-tasks is moved to In Progress, Stories remain in Open status, Parent issue should be marked as in-progress as well

fields.description: Per subject, please refer to the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Add "View Sprint in Issue Navigator" button in the Scrum board "Plan" view

fields.description:
Every time I create a story in agile board, after the issue is created I have to click on it and specify the estimate in story points on the right panel. 

I think this is just one extra step and can be avoided by directly putting in the estimate when creating the issue.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to put in the estimate (story points) when I create a story

fields.description:
Hi

We're having a difficult time trying to organize our tickets using the new planning board. Issues such as: 
- Who is working on what
- How high priority is this ticket and where should it go in the queue
- What part of the project(s) is this ticket from

We have had to start putting a lot of this information in the issue title
e.g. AP : <PRODUCT NAME> : <FEATURE NAME> : <User story> and I still cannot see easily who the ticket is assigned to.

All the cool dropdowns Jira comes with to distinguish the issue go out the window with this new planning board.

Cheers
Bjorn
fields.summary: As a User, I can see the project, component, priority, assignee and title of the story on the planning board

fields.description: From a fixed issue in a previous version it seems that this was resolved.  However, using 6.0.3 we found that the orignal estimated time becomes zeroed out when the remaining time is set to zero using a post function.
fields.summary: When using a post function to zero out remaining time, the estimated time also goes to zero

fields.description: If the estimated time is separate from the remaining since it's suppose to represent different things, then why does one affect the other.  This posses an issue when we are planning since it effectively doubles the remaining time automatically.
fields.summary: How come the remaining value includes the estimation from the parent task?

fields.description:
In the Structure plugin, we would like to tap into Rapid Boards configuration, namely:
- get a list of rapid boards
- get rapid board filter, sub-filter, ranking field, estimation method
- get quick filters set up for the rapid boards

Other things like swimlane configurations will be nice to have as well, although currently not needed in our plugin.

Having this feature will allow us to more tightly integrate Structure with Rapid Board - for example, synchronize rank changes only for those issues that are on the rapid board.

Thanks!
Igor
fields.summary: As a JIRA plugin developer, I would like to access Agile Board configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6053].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when the swimlanes are based on Stories, issues without sub-tasks are shown at the bottom.

h3. Suggested Solution
* It would be a great feature if they were shown on top, or to have the option to display at the bottom or top, similar to the behavior when grouping the by Assignee that you can choose if the Unassigned issues will be placed on the top or on the bottom.
* Issues should appear in rank order in the work board, irrespective of whether or not swimlanes are used for subtasks, and regardless of whether the issue has any subtasks.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: When basing swimlanes by Stories it would be a great feature to choose where issues without sub-tasks will be shown.

fields.description: If the field contains multiple values, we could either select random first one wins or set use separate color for multiple.
fields.summary: As a user I want to assign a Card Color Scheme to a Field like Labels, Components or fixVersions so that I do not have to set up a color for each sole value.

fields.description:
On the new board, whenever an issue contains subtask(s), the story point for the parent issue will not be displayed.
!sp.png!

It would be convenience for users to display the story point on the parent task as well.
fields.summary: The new board should display the Story Point on the parent task

fields.description: {{As a Scrum of Scrum User i want to either transfer QuickFilters and CardColors between Agile Boards or manage them centrally so that I don't have to copy and paste my JQLs line by line therefore.}}
fields.summary: Ability to manage Agile board settings centrally or transfer them to other boards

fields.description:
Currently there is no technical connection between priority and ranking whereas some users are tempted to set priority to some value which is just disregarded in Agile views.
On the other hand, there is no possibility to influence the ranking in the detail/edit views of the issue nor on the issue navigator level.

An idea could also be to have a functionality to just reorder the backlog by priority.
fields.summary: As a Product Owner I want to set the Ranking instead or beneath the Priority of (new) issues so that the Backog order is correct

fields.description:
Several small improvements could help, i.e:
- Having possibilities to launch the Issue Navigator with a) the backlog b) a planned sprint c) the running sprint or d) the current selection
- card colors like GHS-6052
- show fixVersion as sort of a corner field in the classic agile boards
- icons for fixVersions, like there are for issue types
fields.summary: As a Product Owner I want to see and set the fixVersions within the Agile Board's Plan view listing so that I can synchronize sprints and releases

fields.description:
* Introduce a permission to limit editing of Rank or
* Add Rank to the list of fields that allows history searches so that I can query which stories were re-ranked
fields.summary: As Product Owner I want to own the ordering of the Product Backlog

fields.description:
Product Owner wants to use Rapid Board's Planing view to drag issues from backlog to a sprint. She doesn't want to see closed or resolved issues in a backlog.

Developer wants to use Rapid Board's Work view to track her work progress. She want to see every closed or resolved issue as long as the issue is in the sprint. 

Product Owner wants to use other sorting order in the Rapid Board's Backlog than the Rapid Board's Work view has.
fields.summary: Rapid Board Backlog's filter should be separated from the Board filter itseft

fields.description:
h2. Acceptance Criteroa (in addition to GHS-6044)

* For highlighting quick filters, I can select a field (for example due date), which is shown in the list of PBIs
* This field only shows when highlight filter query is active, so that ui is not cluttered
* This field could even replace the estimate field while the hightlight quick filter is active
fields.summary: As Product Owner I want to see additional fields in Plan View for highlighted PBIs so that I can make better decisions in ordering them

fields.description:
h2. Acceptance Criteria
* Quick Filters can be toggled to highlight rather than filter. Options depending on usability considerations:
** either in the creation screen (=> something is either a quick filter or a quick highlight)
** or in the plan view itself (=> quickfilter can be used eithier for filterering or highlighting)
* Plan views shows highlighted and non-highlighted items, ranking is possible between these
* I can highlight, for example
** duedate <= "4w"
** priority = Blocker
** risk >= 5
fields.summary: As a Product Owner I want to highlight rather than filter certain Product Backlog Items in Plan View so that I can still rank PBI in comparison to unhighlighted PBI

fields.description:
I have not verified this, but I experienced it on JAC once.

I have a board open in one browser window always.
In another window I opened JAC and I was logged out, so I logged back in.
Then later, I went back to the board, and the board auto-refreshed. The data loaded fine.
But then later I tried to transition an issue, but I got the "Token expired retry" dialog.

Not sure if we can do anything about this when doing our polling for staleness, but if we can that might be good.
fields.summary: XSRF Token is out of date after being logged out and logged in and seeing board refresh
Latest Chrome still cutting off the last word at zoom level 120%

fields.description: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/GHS-6039+Highlight+for+Filters
fields.summary: Highlight mode for filters (i.e find those issues against all the others rather than filtering to just those issues)
